page.title: 11AGRICULTURE IN THE AREA
page.content: There are numerous farms in our area,ranging in size from the small family farms such as Idlerock Farm at grid reference 933376 to the much larger farms like dale farm at grid reference 947384.The type of farming undertaken ranges widely with the land type,technology and investment. The smaller"homestead" farms in the area tend to specialise in dairy farming or on sheep.The larger more capitally intensive will also undertake cereal growing.Cereals are grown either for fodder or for sale. Besides these main types of farming,one can also see examples of rape(this crop has increased because of Common Market intervention prices and is used as an edible oil),potatoes and turnips. As a long term investment some landowners have kept areas of mixed woodland and pasture for horse grazing
